data.text:
(a) Liquidation Preference

In the event of the Company‚Äôs liquidation, each of the ECF Shares subscribers shall be paid an amount equal to one time (1x) nonparticipating preference of the aggregate original subscription price per ECF Shares for all the ECF Shares held by that subscriber, provided that if there are insufficient assets and funds of the Company to pay the Liquidation Preference amount to all holders of ECF Shares, then the assets and funds shall be distributed to the holders of ECF Shares pro rata to their respective holdings of ECF Shares;

(b) Automatic Conversion rights

Upon obtaining the approved IPO (‚ÄúConversion Event‚Äù), ECF Shares shall be automatically converted into Ordinary Shares, subject to the terms and conditions stated in the Shareholders Agreement.

(c) Ranking

The ECF Shares shall rank equally amongst themselves and the Preference Shares in all respects but shall rank in priority to all Ordinary Shares.

(d) Voting rights

The Voting rights of the ECF Shares subscriber shall be limited to the Reserved Matters of Preference Shareholders only.

(e) Tag-Along rights

The ECF subscriber shall be entitled to exercise their Tag-Along rights in the event any of the Founders of the Company decides to transfer their shares to another party.

(f) Redemption rights

The Redemption rights allow the Company to but does not obligate, redeem the ECF Shares from the ECF Shares subscriber, subject to the Company having successfully attained Profit After Tax (PAT) of RM 15.8 mil within its audited financials for the financial year ending 2027 (‚ÄúRedemption Event‚Äù).

In the event of the Redemption Event, the ECF Shares subscriber is entitled to redeem up to 7.82% of the ECF Shares subscribed by each respective ECF Share subscriber, at a premium of 1.5 times the originally subscribed ECF Shares price, within 6 months from the date of such Redemption Event.

The Company shall have full discretion and is not obligated to redeem the remaining 50% of each ECF Share subscriber‚Äôs total ECF Shares.

(g) Dividend

Class 1: Investments in the range of RM 1,888 to 15,000

The owner of Shares within this class (with a minimum investment amount of RM 1,888 to RM 15,000 in value) shall be entitled to fixed cumulative dividends at the rate of 8% per annum on the investment amount (payable annually at the end of each financial year), commencing from the 3rd financial year post the date of issuance of the Shares, until the Shares are redeemed or converted in accordance with this Term Sheet.

Class 2: Investments in the range of RM 16,000 to RM 49,000

The owner of Shares within this class (with a minimum investment amount of RM 16,000.00 to RM 49,000.00 in value) shall be entitled to fixed cumulative dividends at the rate of 8.5% per annum on the investment amount (payable annually at the end of each financial year), commencing from the 3rd financial year post the date of issuance of the Shares, until the Shares are redeemed or converted in accordance with this Term Sheet.

Class 3: Investments in the range of RM 50,000 to RM 99,000

The owner of Shares within this class (with a minimum investment amount of RM 50,000.00 and above in value) shall be entitled to fixed cumulative dividends at the rate of 9.0% per annum on the investment amount (payable annually at the end of each financial year), commencing from the 3rd financial year post the date of issuance of the Shares, until the Shares are redeemed or converted in accordance with this Term Sheet.

Class 4: Investments of RM 100,000 and above

The owner of Shares within this class (with a minimum investment amount of RM 100,000.00 and above in value) shall be entitled to fixed cumulative dividends at the rate of 9.5% per annum on the investment amount (payable annually at the end of each financial year), commencing from the 3rd financial year post the date of issuance of the Shares, until the Shares are redeemed or converted in accordance with this Term Sheet.

The information, calculations and remarks expressed on this term sheet or on any other part of the platform are based on information provided, disclosed and presented by the Issuer, VNI SCIENTIFIC SDN BHD to Ata Plus Sdn Bhd, either in part or in whole.

Ata Plus disclaims responsibility for the accuracy, completeness and/or validity of these information, and hence will not be held liable for any inaccurate, inappropriate or incomplete information presented on this term sheet or on any other part of the platform subject to the following :

The financial information listed on the Deal page is provided by the Issuer; which includes the financial forecasts and projections, the capitalisation table, the term sheet, and management accounts.

The financial forecasts and projections have been prepared by the Issuer based on assumptions that have not been reviewed and certified by an independent certified accountant for its reasonableness.

THE ISSUER agrees that; all information concerning the product, business and the assets of THE ISSUER that have been furnished to Ata Plus Sdn Bhd for the purpose of the equity crowdfunding campaign is true, complete, and accurate in all material respects and is not misleading or deceptive whether by inclusion or omission.

Should the Investor require more information, they can do so by contacting VNI SCIENTIFIC SDN BHD directly at :

Name : Norsavina Kaharudin

Email : admin@vniscientific.com

HP : +606 6751205 / +6013 266 6456

or by clicking on the ‚ÄòCONTACT‚Äô button on the Deals Page.
